val.name: Node
val.description: An object with an ID

fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally unique ID for the object

val.name: ID
val.description:
The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to
refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON
response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable.
When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer
(such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

val.name: ContentNode
val.description: Nodes used to manage content

fields.name: databaseId
fields.description: The ID of the object in the database.

fields.name: date
fields.description: Post publishing date.

fields.name: dateGmt
fields.description: The publishing date set in GMT.

fields.name: desiredSlug
fields.description: The desired slug of the post

fields.name: editLast
fields.description: The user that most recently edited the object

fields.name: editLock
fields.description: If a user has edited the object within the past 15 seconds, this will return the user and the time they last edited. Null if the edit lock doesn't exist or is greater than 15 seconds

fields.name: enclosure
fields.description: The RSS enclosure for the object

fields.name: enqueuedScripts
fields.description: Connection between the ContentNode type and the EnqueuedScript type

fields.name: enqueuedStylesheets
fields.description: Connection between the ContentNode type and the EnqueuedStylesheet type

fields.name: guid
fields.description: The global unique identifier for this post. This currently matches the value stored in WP_Post->guid and the guid column in the "post_objects" database table.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally unique identifier of the node.

fields.name: isRestricted
fields.description: Whether the object is restricted from the current viewer

fields.name: link
fields.description: The permalink of the post

fields.name: modified
fields.description: The local modified time for a post. If a post was recently updated the modified field will change to match the corresponding time.

fields.name: modifiedGmt
fields.description: The GMT modified time for a post. If a post was recently updated the modified field will change to match the corresponding time in GMT.

fields.name: slug
fields.description: The uri slug for the post. This is equivalent to the WP_Post->post_name field and the post_name column in the database for the "post_objects" table.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current status of the object

fields.name: uri
fields.description: URI path for the resource

val.name: Int
val.description:
The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric
values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

val.name: String
val.description:
The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8
character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to
represent free-form human-readable text.

val.name: User
val.description: A User object

fields.name: actionMonitorActions
fields.description: Connection between the User type and the ActionMonitorAction type

fields.name: avatar
fields.description: Avatar object for user. The avatar object can be retrieved in different sizes by specifying the size argument.

fields.name: capKey
fields.description: User metadata option name. Usually it will be "wp_capabilities".

fields.name: capabilities
fields.description: A list of capabilities (permissions) granted to the user

fields.name: comments
fields.description: Connection between the User type and the Comment type

fields.name: databaseId
fields.description: Identifies the primary key from the database.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the user.

fields.name: email
fields.description: Email address of the user. This is equivalent to the WP_User->user_email property.

fields.name: enqueuedScripts
fields.description: Connection between the User type and the EnqueuedScript type

fields.name: enqueuedStylesheets
fields.description: Connection between the User type and the EnqueuedStylesheet type

fields.name: extraCapabilities
fields.description: A complete list of capabilities including capabilities inherited from a role. This is equivalent to the array keys of WP_User->allcaps.

fields.name: firstName
fields.description: First name of the user. This is equivalent to the WP_User->user_first_name property.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally unique identifier for the user object.

fields.name: isRestricted
fields.description: Whether the object is restricted from the current viewer

fields.name: lastName
fields.description: Last name of the user. This is equivalent to the WP_User->user_last_name property.

fields.name: locale
fields.description: The preferred language locale set for the user. Value derived from get_user_locale().

fields.name: mediaItems
fields.description: Connection between the User type and the mediaItem type

fields.name: name
fields.description: Display name of the user. This is equivalent to the WP_User->dispaly_name property.

fields.name: nicename
fields.description: The nicename for the user. This field is equivalent to WP_User->user_nicename

fields.name: nickname
fields.description: Nickname of the user.

fields.name: pages
fields.description: Connection between the User type and the page type

fields.name: posts
fields.description: Connection between the User type and the post type

fields.name: registeredDate
fields.description: The date the user registered or was created. The field follows a full ISO8601 date string format.

fields.name: revisions
fields.description: Connection between the User and Revisions authored by the user

fields.name: roles
fields.description: Connection between the User type and the UserRole type

fields.name: slug
fields.description: The slug for the user. This field is equivalent to WP_User->user_nicename

fields.name: uri
fields.description: The unique resource identifier path

fields.name: url
fields.description: A website url that is associated with the user.

fields.name: userId
fields.description: The Id of the user. Equivalent to WP_User->ID

fields.name: username
fields.description: Username for the user. This field is equivalent to WP_User->user_login.

val.name: EditLock
val.description: Info on whether the object is locked by another user editing it

fields.name: editTime
fields.description: The time when the object was last edited

fields.name: user
fields.description: The user that most recently edited the object

val.name: ContentNodeToEnqueuedScriptConnection
val.description: Connection between the ContentNode type and the EnqueuedScript type

fields.name: edges
fields.description: Edges for the ContentNodeToEnqueuedScriptConnection connection

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: The nodes of the connection, without the edges

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information about pagination in a connection.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: Edges for the ContentNodeToEnqueuedStylesheetConnection connection

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: The nodes of the connection, without the edges

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information about pagination in a connection.

val.name: Boolean
val.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

fields.description: The srcset attribute specifies the URL of the image to use in different situations. It is a comma separated string of urls and their widths.

val.name: Settings
val.description: All of the registered settings

fields.name: discussionSettingsDefaultCommentStatus
fields.description: Allow people to submit comments on new posts.

fields.name: discussionSettingsDefaultPingStatus
fields.description: Allow link notifications from other blogs (pingbacks and trackbacks) on new articles.

fields.name: generalSettingsDateFormat
fields.description: A date format for all date strings.

fields.name: generalSettingsDescription
fields.description: Site tagline.

fields.name: generalSettingsEmail
fields.description: This address is used for admin purposes, like new user notification.

fields.name: generalSettingsLanguage
fields.description: WordPress locale code.

fields.name: generalSettingsStartOfWeek
fields.description: A day number of the week that the week should start on.

fields.name: generalSettingsTimeFormat
fields.description: A time format for all time strings.

fields.name: generalSettingsTimezone
fields.description: A city in the same timezone as you.

fields.name: generalSettingsTitle
fields.description: Site title.

fields.name: generalSettingsUrl
fields.description: Site URL.

fields.name: readingSettingsPostsPerPage
fields.description: Blog pages show at most.

fields.name: writingSettingsDefaultCategory
fields.description: Default post category.

fields.name: writingSettingsDefaultPostFormat
fields.description: Default post format.

fields.name: writingSettingsUseSmilies
fields.description: Convert emoticons like :-) and :-P to graphics on display.

val.name: Comment
val.description: A Comment object

fields.name: agent
fields.description: User agent used to post the comment. This field is equivalent to WP_Comment->comment_agent and the value matching the "comment_agent" column in SQL.

fields.name: approved
fields.description: The approval status of the comment. This field is equivalent to WP_Comment->comment_approved and the value matching the "comment_approved" column in SQL.

fields.name: author
fields.description: The author of the comment

fields.name: authorIp
fields.description: IP address for the author. This field is equivalent to WP_Comment->comment_author_IP and the value matching the "comment_author_IP" column in SQL.

fields.name: children
fields.description: Connection between the Comment type and the Comment type

fields.name: commentId
fields.description: ID for the comment, unique among comments.

fields.name: commentedOn
fields.description: The object the comment was added to

fields.name: content
fields.description: Content of the comment. This field is equivalent to WP_Comment->comment_content and the value matching the "comment_content" column in SQL.

fields.name: date
fields.description: Date the comment was posted in local time. This field is equivalent to WP_Comment->date and the value matching the "date" column in SQL.

fields.name: dateGmt
fields.description: Date the comment was posted in GMT. This field is equivalent to WP_Comment->date_gmt and the value matching the "date_gmt" column in SQL.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally unique identifier for the comment object

fields.name: isRestricted
fields.description: Whether the object is restricted from the current viewer

fields.name: karma
fields.description: Karma value for the comment. This field is equivalent to WP_Comment->comment_karma and the value matching the "comment_karma" column in SQL.

fields.name: parent
fields.description: Parent comment of current comment. This field is equivalent to the WP_Comment instance matching the WP_Comment->comment_parent ID.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of comment. This field is equivalent to WP_Comment->comment_type and the value matching the "comment_type" column in SQL.

val.name: ContentType
val.description: An Post Type object

fields.name: canExport
fields.description: Whether this content type should can be exported.

fields.name: connectedTaxonomies
fields.description: Connection between the ContentType type and the Taxonomy type

fields.name: deleteWithUser
fields.description: Whether delete this type of content when the author of it is deleted from the system.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the content type.

fields.name: excludeFromSearch
fields.description: Whether to exclude posts with this post type from front end search results.

fields.name: graphqlPluralName
fields.description: The plural name of the post type within the GraphQL Schema.

fields.name: graphqlSingleName
fields.description: The singular name of the post type within the GraphQL Schema.

fields.name: hasArchive
fields.description: Whether this content type should have archives. Content archives are generated by type and by date.

fields.name: hierarchical
fields.description: Whether the post type is hierarchical, for example pages.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally unique identifier of the post-type object.

fields.name: isRestricted
fields.description: Whether the object is restricted from the current viewer

fields.name: label
fields.description: Display name of the content type.

fields.name: labels
fields.description: Details about the post type labels.

fields.name: menuIcon
fields.description: The name of the icon file to display as a menu icon.

fields.name: menuPosition
fields.description: The position of this post type in the menu. Only applies if show_in_menu is true.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The internal name of the post type. This should not be used for display purposes.

fields.name: public
fields.description: Whether a post type is intended for use publicly either via the admin interface or by front-end users. While the default settings of exclude_from_search, publicly_queryable, show_ui, and show_in_nav_menus are inherited from public, each does not rely on this relationship and controls a very specific intention.

fields.name: publiclyQueryable
fields.description: Whether queries can be performed on the front end for the post type as part of parse_request().

fields.name: restBase
fields.description: Name of content type to diplay in REST API "wp/v2" namespace.

fields.name: restControllerClass
fields.description: The REST Controller class assigned to handling this content type.

fields.name: showInAdminBar
fields.description: Makes this post type available via the admin bar.

fields.name: showInGraphql
fields.description: Whether to add the post type to the GraphQL Schema.

fields.name: showInMenu
fields.description: Where to show the post type in the admin menu. To work, $show_ui must be true. If true, the post type is shown in its own top level menu. If false, no menu is shown. If a string of an existing top level menu (eg. "tools.php" or "edit.php?post_type=page"), the post type will be placed as a sub-menu of that.

fields.name: showInNavMenus
fields.description: Makes this post type available for selection in navigation menus.

fields.name: showInRest
fields.description: Whether to add the post type route in the REST API "wp/v2" namespace.

fields.name: showUi
fields.description: Whether to generate and allow a UI for managing this post type in the admin.

val.name: DiscussionSettings
val.description: The discussion setting type

fields.name: defaultCommentStatus
fields.description: Allow people to submit comments on new posts.

fields.name: defaultPingStatus
fields.description: Allow link notifications from other blogs (pingbacks and trackbacks) on new articles.

fields.name: startOfWeek

fields.name: timeFormat
fields.description: A time format for all time strings.

fields.name: timezone
fields.description: A city in the same timezone as you.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Site title.

fields.name: url
fields.description: Site URL.

val.name: MenuItem
val.description: Navigation menu items are the individual items assigned to a menu. These are rendered as the links in a navigation menu.

fields.name: childItems
fields.description: Connection between the MenuItem type and the MenuItem type

fields.name: connectedObject
fields.description: The object connected to this menu item.

fields.name: cssClasses
fields.description: Class attribute for the menu item link

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the menu item.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally unique identifier of the nav menu item object.

fields.name: isRestricted
fields.description: Whether the object is restricted from the current viewer

fields.name: label
fields.description: Label or title of the menu item.

fields.name: linkRelationship
fields.description: Link relationship (XFN) of the menu item.

fields.name: menuItemId
fields.description: WP ID of the menu item.

fields.name: target
fields.description: Target attribute for the menu item link.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title attribute for the menu item link

fields.name: url
fields.description: URL or destination of the menu item.

val.name: Menu
val.description: Menus are the containers for navigation items. Menus can be assigned to menu locations, which are typically registered by the active theme.

fields.name: count
fields.description: The number of items in the menu

fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally unique identifier of the nav menu object.

fields.name: isRestricted
fields.description: Whether the object is restricted from the current viewer

fields.name: menuId
fields.description: WP ID of the nav menu.

fields.name: menuItems
fields.description: Connection between the Menu type and the MenuItem type

fields.name: name
fields.description: Display name of the menu. Equivalent to WP_Term->name.

fields.name: slug
fields.description: The url friendly name of the menu. Equivalent to WP_Term->slug

val.name: Page
val.description: The page type

fields.name: author
fields.description: The author field will return a queryable User type matching the post's author.

fields.name: childPages
fields.description: Connection between the page type and the page type

fields.name: commentCount
fields.description: The number of comments. Even though WPGraphQL denotes this field as an integer, in WordPress this field should be saved as a numeric string for compatibility.

fields.name: commentStatus
fields.description: Whether the comments are open or closed for this particular post.

fields.name: comments
fields.description: Connection between the page type and the Comment type

fields.name: content
fields.description: The content of the post.

fields.name: contentType
fields.description: Connection between the page type and the ContentType type

fields.name: databaseId
fields.description: The ID of the object in the database.

fields.name: date
fields.description: Post publishing date.

fields.name: dateGmt
fields.description: The publishing date set in GMT.

fields.name: desiredSlug
fields.description: The desired slug of the post

fields.name: editLast
fields.description: The user that most recently edited the object

fields.name: editLock
fields.description: If a user has edited the object within the past 15 seconds, this will return the user and the time they last edited. Null if the edit lock doesn't exist or is greater than 15 seconds

fields.name: enclosure
fields.description: The RSS enclosure for the object

fields.name: enqueuedScripts
fields.description: Connection between the ContentNode type and the EnqueuedScript type

fields.name: enqueuedStylesheets
fields.description: Connection between the ContentNode type and the EnqueuedStylesheet type

fields.name: featuredImage
fields.description: The featured image for the object

fields.name: guid
fields.description: The global unique identifier for this post. This currently matches the value stored in WP_Post->guid and the guid column in the "post_objects" database table.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally unique identifier of the page object.

fields.name: isFrontPage
fields.description: Whether this page is set to the static front page.

fields.name: isRestricted
fields.description: Whether the object is restricted from the current viewer

fields.name: isRevision
fields.description: True if the node is a revision of another node

fields.name: link
fields.description: The permalink of the post

fields.name: menuOrder
fields.description: A field used for ordering posts. This is typically used with nav menu items or for special ordering of hierarchical content types.

fields.name: modified
fields.description: The local modified time for a post. If a post was recently updated the modified field will change to match the corresponding time.

fields.name: modifiedGmt
fields.description: The GMT modified time for a post. If a post was recently updated the modified field will change to match the corresponding time in GMT.

fields.name: parent
fields.description: The parent of the object. The parent object can be of various types

fields.name: parentDatabaseId
fields.description: Database id of the parent object

fields.name: parentId
fields.description: The globally unique identifier of the parent object.

fields.name: revisionOf
fields.description: If the current node is a revision, this field exposes the node this is a revision of. Returns null if the node is not a revision of another node.

fields.name: revisions
fields.description: Connection between the page type and the page type

fields.name: slug
fields.description: The uri slug for the post. This is equivalent to the WP_Post->post_name field and the post_name column in the database for the "post_objects" table.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current status of the object

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the post. This is currently just the raw title. An amendment to support rendered title needs to be made.

fields.name: uri
fields.description: URI path for the resource

val.name: Plugin
val.description: An plugin object

fields.name: author
fields.description: Name of the plugin author(s), may also be a company name.

fields.name: authorUri
fields.description: URI for the related author(s)/company website.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the plugin.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally unique identifier of the plugin object.

fields.name: isRestricted
fields.description: Whether the object is restricted from the current viewer

fields.name: name
fields.description: Display name of the plugin.

fields.name: path
fields.description: Plugin path.

fields.name: pluginUri
fields.description: URI for the plugin website. This is useful for directing users for support requests etc.

fields.name: version
fields.description: Current version of the plugin.

val.description: A taxonomy object

fields.name: connectedPostTypeNames
fields.description: A list of Post Types associated with the taxonomy

fields.name: connectedPostTypes
fields.description: List of Post Types connected to the Taxonomy

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the taxonomy. This field is equivalent to WP_Taxonomy->description

fields.name: graphqlPluralName
fields.description: The plural name of the post type within the GraphQL Schema.

fields.name: graphqlSingleName
fields.description: The singular name of the post type within the GraphQL Schema.

fields.name: hierarchical
fields.description: Whether the taxonomy is hierarchical

fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally unique identifier of the taxonomy object.

fields.name: isRestricted
fields.description: Whether the object is restricted from the current viewer

fields.name: label
fields.description: Name of the taxonomy shown in the menu. Usually plural.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The display name of the taxonomy. This field is equivalent to WP_Taxonomy->label

fields.name: public
fields.description: Whether the taxonomy is publicly queryable

fields.name: restBase
fields.description: Name of content type to diplay in REST API "wp/v2" namespace.

fields.name: restControllerClass
fields.description: The REST Controller class assigned to handling this content type.

fields.name: showCloud
fields.description: Whether to show the taxonomy as part of a tag cloud widget. This field is equivalent to WP_Taxonomy->show_tagcloud

fields.name: showInAdminColumn
fields.description: Whether to display a column for the taxonomy on its post type listing screens.

fields.name: showInGraphql
fields.description: Whether to add the post type to the GraphQL Schema.

fields.name: showInMenu
fields.description: Whether to show the taxonomy in the admin menu

fields.name: showInNavMenus
fields.description: Whether the taxonomy is available for selection in navigation menus.

fields.name: showInQuickEdit
fields.description: Whether to show the taxonomy in the quick/bulk edit panel.

fields.name: showInRest
fields.description: Whether to add the post type route in the REST API "wp/v2" namespace.

fields.name: showUi
fields.description: Whether to generate and allow a UI for managing terms in this taxonomy in the admin

val.name: Theme
val.description: A theme object

fields.name: author
fields.description: Name of the theme author(s), could also be a company name. This field is equivalent to WP_Theme->get( "Author" ).

fields.name: authorUri
fields.description: URI for the author/company website. This field is equivalent to WP_Theme->get( "AuthorURI" ).

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the theme. This field is equivalent to WP_Theme->get( "Description" ).

fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally unique identifier of the theme object.

fields.name: isRestricted
fields.description: Whether the object is restricted from the current viewer

fields.name: name
fields.description: Display name of the theme. This field is equivalent to WP_Theme->get( "Name" ).

fields.name: screenshot
fields.description: The URL of the screenshot for the theme. The screenshot is intended to give an overview of what the theme looks like. This field is equivalent to WP_Theme->get_screenshot().

fields.name: slug
fields.description: The theme slug is used to internally match themes. Theme slugs can have subdirectories like: my-theme/sub-theme. This field is equivalent to WP_Theme->get_stylesheet().

fields.name: tags
fields.description: URI for the author/company website. This field is equivalent to WP_Theme->get( "Tags" ).

fields.name: themeUri
fields.description: A URI if the theme has a website associated with it. The Theme URI is handy for directing users to a theme site for support etc. This field is equivalent to WP_Theme->get( "ThemeURI" ).

fields.name: version
fields.description: The current version of the theme. This field is equivalent to WP_Theme->get( "Version" ).

val.name: Avatar
val.description: Avatars are profile images for users. WordPress by default uses the Gravatar service to host and fetch avatars from.

fields.name: default
fields.description: URL for the default image or a default type. Accepts '404' (return a 404 instead of a default image), 'retro' (8bit), 'monsterid' (monster), 'wavatar' (cartoon face), 'indenticon' (the 'quilt'), 'mystery', 'mm', or 'mysteryman' (The Oyster Man), 'blank' (transparent GIF), or 'gravatar_default' (the Gravatar logo).

fields.name: extraAttr
fields.description: HTML attributes to insert in the IMG element. Is not sanitized.

fields.name: forceDefault
fields.description: Whether to always show the default image, never the Gravatar.

fields.name: foundAvatar
fields.description: Whether the avatar was successfully found.

fields.name: height
fields.description: Height of the avatar image.

fields.name: isRestricted
fields.description: Whether the object is restricted from the current viewer

fields.name: rating
fields.description: What rating to display avatars up to. Accepts 'G', 'PG', 'R', 'X', and are judged in that order.

fields.name: scheme
fields.description: Type of url scheme to use. Typically HTTP vs. HTTPS.

fields.name: size
fields.description: The size of the avatar in pixels. A value of 96 will match a 96px x 96px gravatar image.

fields.name: url
fields.description: URL for the gravatar image source.

fields.name: width
fields.description: Width of the avatar image.

val.description: Connection between the User type and the Comment type

fields.description: Edges for the UserToCommentConnection connection

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: The nodes of the connection, without the edges

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information about pagination in a connection.
